message: but basically, I want to serialize SQLAlchemy models with respect to access controls based on the request
I have a question on stack overflow: http://stackoverflow.com/q/5232461/133514
I think this is a pretty good use case for aspect oriented programming
SqlAlchemy has a built in de/serializer.
no need to reinvent the wheel
ack why are the 0.5 docs *still* coming up in google....I've had it in robots.txt for like a month now - please use the current docs http://www.sqlalchemy.org/docs/core/serializer.html

though I would note that the serializer extension is explicitly *not* for the use case described in that post.   Mapped objects are already pickleable through normal means.   As far as the "aspect" mentioned, I think mixin classes give the best bang for the buck in this use case (i.e. Serializable mixin).
I am assuming that he does not want to output resources in the pickle format? Unless I am missing something? The example on SO seems to be using json.
